tabTitle[1]list[1]itemTitle[1]: Page layout on the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[1]videoTitle[1]: Page layout on the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[1]videoDescription[1]: In the first web feature – Page layout on the portal – we will explore the arrangement of visual elements, a crucial aspect that influences the structure and user experience of the site. We'll cover key components such as the site header, footer, main and right sidebars, and main content area, emphasizing the importance of intuitive navigation. Additionally, we'll highlight special functionalities like clickable logos, external links opening in new tabs, and admin capabilities for managing content sections.
tabTitle[1]list[1]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Page layout on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[2]itemTitle[1]: Page layout on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[2]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the first feature, we will take a look at the layout structure from the perspective of a logged-in and a non-logged-in user,  how does the user profile section in the header look when you are a logged-in or a non-logged-in user, and how do user profile pages look when you are logged-in. We’ll also look at the site header section, site footer section, site main navigation section on the left side, main content area section and the right sidebar section as an admin user, and how admin users can act as regular users by switching between admin and user view.
tabTitle[1]list[2]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Page layout on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[3]itemTitle[1]: Maintain navigation on the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[3]videoDescription[1]: In the second web feature – Maintain navigation on the portal – we will explore the navigation menu on the left side of every Sports Hub site page and what items it consists of, namely Home, News pages, Lifestyle, Dealbook, Video and Team hub. We’ll cover categories that have subcategories (for example, the NFL sports category) and those which are static (Lifestyle, Dealbook, Video, and Team hub). Additionally, we'll view how an admin user can configure the navigation menu categories, subcategories, and teams.
tabTitle[1]list[3]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Maintain navigation on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[4]itemTitle[1]: Maintain navigation on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[4]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the second feature, we will take a look at what configuration options do the admin users have over the navigation on the Sports Hub portal: how they can create navigation menu items, show or hide them from the user, and change their order or move between categories. We’ll also look at how admin users can add a new team, edit existing teams, filter the Teams page and delete existing teams. Finally, we’ll see how a site user can use the navigation menu to move between sports categories, subcategories, and teams news pages.
tabTitle[1]list[4]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Maintain navigation on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[5]itemTitle[1]: Log in and sign up to the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[5]videoDescription[1]: In the third web feature – Log in and sign up to the portal – we will explore user personal accounts on the Sports Hub site, namely how they can create one or log in to an existing one. Additionally, we'll view the “Forgot password?” functionality, as well as how admin users can log in using the seeded data.
tabTitle[1]list[5]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Log in and sign up to the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[6]itemTitle[1]: Log in and sign up to the portal - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[6]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the third feature, we will take a look at how site users can sign up/log in on the portal using an email and how they can reset their password. We’ll also look at how to create a script to seed admin data to the database and how admin users can log in with an email and password.
tabTitle[1]list[6]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Log in and sign up to the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[7]itemTitle[1]: Site languages on the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[7]videoDescription[1]: In the fourth web feature – Site languages on the portal – we will explore the available languages on the site (which are present in the right section of the header) and how the content of the site is translated to the language, chosen by the user or admin. Additionally, we'll see how an admin can configure the list of available languages.
tabTitle[1]list[7]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Site languages on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[8]itemTitle[1]: Site languages on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[8]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the fourth feature, we will take a look at how admin users can configure site languages on the portal and configure content in multiple languages. We’ll also look at how admin users and site users can change the site language.
tabTitle[1]list[8]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Site languages on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[9]itemTitle[1]: Manage articles on the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[9]videoDescription[1]: In the fifth web feature – Manage articles on the portal – we will explore how admin users can manage the articles, namely add new articles, view/edit/delete existing ones, publish or unpublish articles, change their category and turn the comments on or off.
tabTitle[1]list[9]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Manage articles on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[10]itemTitle[1]: Manage articles on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[10]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the fifth feature, we will take a look at how admin users can add new articles, view the list of existing articles per category and edit/publish/unpublish/move/delete an existing article. We’ll also look at the advanced image editing options of an admin user: how they can update/delete/crop/resize an image and apply filters to it.
tabTitle[1]list[10]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Manage articles on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[11]itemTitle[1]: Articles - user side on the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[11]videoDescription[1]: In the sixth web feature – Articles - user side on the portal – we will explore how users can view article pages that are related to a specific category or team and select a category that interests them from the sidebar menu.
tabTitle[1]list[11]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Articles - user side on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[12]itemTitle[1]: Articles - user side on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[12]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the sixth feature, we will take a look at how users can view an article page (with the article photo, headline, metadata etc.), see the More Articles block containing more articles from the same category as the currently opened article, and open the category or team page.
tabTitle[1]list[12]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Articles - user side on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[13]itemTitle[1]: Home page of the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[13]videoDescription[1]: In the seventh web feature – Home page of the portal – we will explore the main page of the Sports Hub site, which contains the most recent news and topics. We will learn how to configure the home page sections, such as Main Articles, Breakdown, and Photo of the day.
tabTitle[1]list[13]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Home page of the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[14]itemTitle[1]: Home page of the portal - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[14]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the seventh feature, we will cover how an admin user can configure 3 sections of the Home page, namely the Main articles, Breakdown, and Photo of the day sections, as well as how they can preview the changes made to those sections without saving them. We will also look at these sections from the perspective of an ordinary user and how they can navigate them.
tabTitle[1]list[14]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Home page of the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[1]itemTitle[1]: Social networks on the portal - overview
tabTitle[2]list[1]videoDescription[1]: In the eighth web feature – Social networks on the portal – we will explore how site users can use social networks to log in and sign up to the site, follow Sports Hub, share an article, and view/like Facebook posts and videos. Additionally, we’ll see how admis can configure the available social networks on the portal.
tabTitle[2]list[1]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Social networks on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[2]itemTitle[1]: Social networks on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[2]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the eighth feature, we will cover how admins can configure which social networks can be used to share/follow Sports Hub and sign up/log in to the portal. We will also look at how these actions look from the point of view of a site user.
tabTitle[2]list[2]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Social networks on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[3]itemTitle[1]: Site footer of the portal - overview
tabTitle[2]list[3]videoDescription[1]: In the ninth web feature – Site footer of the portal – we will explore the footer section, which is configured by the admin, and its three columns: Company info, Contributors, Newsletter, as well as the Sports Hub logo, the copyright sign, and the Privacy and Terms links. Additionally, we’ll see what links should be present in the Company info and Contributors columns.
tabTitle[2]list[3]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Site footer of the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[4]itemTitle[1]: Site footer of the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[4]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the ninth feature, we will cover how admins can configure the footer sections (links and content), as well as how site users can see the footer on every page of the portal and the elements that are present it in.
tabTitle[2]list[4]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Site footer of the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[5]itemTitle[1]: Global site search on the portal - overview
tabTitle[2]list[5]videoDescription[1]: In the tenth web feature – Global site search on the portal – we will explore the global site search, located in the header section, that should show all the places where the match with the entered word(s) is found.
tabTitle[2]list[5]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Global site search on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[6]itemTitle[1]: Global site search on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[6]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the tenth feature, we will cover how site users can use the global search to look for the information they’re interested in.
tabTitle[2]list[6]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Global site search on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[7]itemTitle[1]: Comments block on the portal - overview
tabTitle[2]list[7]videoDescription[1]: In the eleventh web feature – Comments block on the portal – we will explore the comments block, that allows users to leave comments on articles/videos, reply to other user’s comments, edit and delete their comments, and like/dislike comments.
tabTitle[2]list[7]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Comments block on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[8]itemTitle[1]: Comments block on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[8]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the eleventh feature, we will cover how site users can leave comments on the article page and like/dislike other user’s comments.
tabTitle[2]list[8]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Comments block on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[9]itemTitle[1]: The most popular and commented articles on the portal - overview
tabTitle[2]list[9]videoDescription[1]: In the twelfth web feature – The most popular and commented articles on the portal – we will explore the Most popular and Most commented sections that contain most popular and most commented articles on the portal. Additionally, we will see what configuration options an admin has over these sections.
tabTitle[2]list[9]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - The most popular and commented articles on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[10]itemTitle[1]: The most popular and commented articles on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[10]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the twelfth feature, we will cover how admins can configure the Most popular and Most commented sections, as well as how site users can view the articles in these two sections.
tabTitle[2]list[10]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - The most popular and commented articles on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[11]videoDescription[1]: In the thirteenth web feature – Lifestyle and Dealbook news – we will explore the news from Lifestyle and Dealbook section. The Lifestyle section contains news about the daily life of sports stars and teams, and the Dealbook section is about financial deals in the sports world, such as transfer of players and rewards. Additionally, we will see what configuration options does an admin have over these sections.
tabTitle[2]list[11]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Lifestyle and Dealbook news:
tabTitle[2]list[12]itemTitle[1]: Lifestyle and Dealbook news - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[12]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the thirteenth feature, we will cover how admins can configure the Lifestyle and Dealbook sections (add new articles, edit/delete existing articles, etc.), as well as how site users can visit open these sections and read the articles.
tabTitle[2]list[12]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Lifestyle and Dealbook news:
tabTitle[2]list[13]itemTitle[1]: Sports videos on the portal - overview
tabTitle[2]list[13]videoDescription[1]: In the fourteenth web feature – Sports videos on the portal – we will explore the Video menu item on the left-side men, that should contain videos, including most popular and most commented ones. Additionally, we will see what configuration options does an admin have over these sections.
tabTitle[2]list[13]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Sports videos on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[14]itemTitle[1]: Sports videos on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[14]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the fourteenth feature, we will cover how admins can add new videos, view/publish/unpublish/edit/delete existing ones, as well as how site users can view videos on the portal and share them on their social networks.
tabTitle[2]list[14]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Sports videos on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[15]videoDescription[1]: In the fifteenth web feature – User personal cabinet – we will explore the personal cabinet of a user where they can view and update their personal info.
tabTitle[2]list[16]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the fifteenth feature, we will cover how users can update their personal information in their personal cabinet and update their password.
tabTitle[2]list[17]itemTitle[1]: Team hub: news about favorite teams - overview
tabTitle[2]list[17]videoDescription[1]: In the sixteenth web feature – Team hub: news about favorite teams – we will explore how users can customize their Team hub page to see news related to their favorite team(-s) or, in case they haven’t selected their favorite team, news about the team from their geolocation.
tabTitle[2]list[17]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Team hub: news about favorite teams:
tabTitle[2]list[18]itemTitle[1]: Team hub: news about favorite teams - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[18]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the sixteenth feature, we will cover how users can select their favorite teams, see news about their favorite teams on the Team hub page, or see news about teams from their geolocation in case they haven’t selected their favorite teams.
tabTitle[2]list[18]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Team hub: news about favorite teams:
tabTitle[2]list[19]itemTitle[1]: Manage news partners on the portal - overview
tabTitle[2]list[19]videoDescription[1]: In the seventeenth web feature – Manage news partners on the portal – we will explore how admins can configure new partners, view existing partners’ configurations and edit the existing partners’ configurations, as well as how they can edit articles from the news partners and process/publish these articles.
tabTitle[2]list[19]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Manage news partners on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[20]itemTitle[1]: Manage news partners on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[20]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the seventeenth feature, we will cover how admins can configure partners on the portal (activate/deactivate existing partners), edit/delete/filter/process news from partners and see the processed articles on the articles list page. Additionally, we’ll see how site users can view news from configured partners in the appropriate categories.
tabTitle[2]list[20]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Manage news partners on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[21]videoDescription[1]: In the eighteenth web feature – Newsletter subscription – we will explore how site users can subscribe and then receive daily news emails from the Sports Hub site, that will be based on subscription type (a subscription to a specific sports category/subcategory/team page or to the Home page).
tabTitle[2]list[22]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the eighteenth feature, we will cover how admins can configure the Newsletter footer section, and how users can subscribe to the Sports Hub site to receive an email with the latest sports news.
tabTitle[2]list[23]itemTitle[1]: User management on the portal - overview
tabTitle[2]list[23]videoDescription[1]: In the nineteenth web feature – User management on the portal – we will explore how admins can review and manage a list of users. Additionally, we will look at what actions does the admin have over the user accounts.
tabTitle[2]list[23]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - User management on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[24]itemTitle[1]: User management on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[24]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the nineteenth feature, we will cover how admins can view the list of viewers on the portal, block/activate/delete user accounts, give/remove admin permissions, see their status/details, search them by name and filter them based on certain criteria. Additionally, we will see the email notification that a user receives when they get blocked/activated, given or taken admin permissions.
tabTitle[2]list[24]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - User management on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[25]videoDescription[1]: In the twentieth web feature – Banners on the portal – we will explore the banners that should be related to the category that the user is viewing. Additionally, we will look at the predefined banners and what configuration options does an admin have over the banners.
tabTitle[2]list[25]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Banners on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[26]itemTitle[1]: Banners on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[26]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the twentieth feature, we will cover how admins can configure normal and predefined banners on the portal. Additionally, we’ll see how users can view normal banners, as well as predefined Lifestyle, Dealbook and Facebook banners in the right sidebar of the site.
tabTitle[2]list[26]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Banners on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[27]itemTitle[1]: Manage advertisements on the portal - overview
tabTitle[2]list[27]videoDescription[1]: In the twenty first web feature – Manage advertisements on the portal – we will explore advertisements (category-related and site-wide), that should be at the top of the right sidebar of the site and which should redirect the user to the advertised website when they click on it. Additionally, we will see what configuration options an admin has over the advertisements.
tabTitle[2]list[27]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Manage advertisements on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[28]itemTitle[1]: Manage advertisements on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[28]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the twenty first feature, we will cover how admins can configure the list of advertisements and how site users can view them on the top of the right sidebar of the site.
tabTitle[2]list[28]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Manage advertisements on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[29]videoDescription[1]: In the twenty second web feature – Surveys on the portal – we will explore surveys, that help collect information from sports fans and build statistics. Additionally, we’ll see what configuration options an admin has over the surveys.
tabTitle[2]list[29]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Surveys on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[30]itemTitle[1]: Surveys on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[30]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the twenty second feature, we will cover how admins can create/publish/close/filter surveys on the portal, as well as how users can see the list of all surveys, participate in surveys on the dedicated My surveys page and on other news pages.
tabTitle[2]list[30]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Surveys on the portal:
